text:
If Nintendo one day stops making it's own hardware, it stands to reason that it's most popular brands will continue to exist on other consoles.
Or maybe Microsoft will fail and Halo will end up Nintendo consoles. You can't really predict these things. I used the example of Sonic because back in the early 90s, I never thought Sega would stop being Nintendo's biggest rival.
And before that, it was thought that video games would be no more than a fleeting fad. It's nice being wrong sometimes.

author: Fahlt

text: Hardly anywhere near an avalanche of titles. Halo may not seem so special now to you but you clearly weren't old enough to play it with your friends when it came out. Some of my most memorable moments in college are of finding at least 4 people in the dorm who had an Xbox and scrounging up enough controllers to kick it on Blood Gulch in Capture the Flag. Not to say the Wii etc. are bad, they have their own list of kick-ass titles, and just like Halo, I have fond memories of them.
author: Fahlt

text: In what way is the Wii plain stupid? I find most of its games funner and more challenging than anything I've played on the 360 or PS3, although this entire generation is pretty casual compared to PS2 and earlier. The 360 is pure FPS and sports games, so it bores the hell of me, and the PS3 has like... Mirror's Edge and almost nothing else. Every console you listed has an avalanche of titles that outclass Halo badly, so I'm not sure what's going on in your head.

author: Romeo Crust

text:
So whats your point? your actually saying the same thing as me, that the players chose wether to play with skill or spam, in both games.
I own the quake quadrilogy and i've played the first two games in competetion, and evry single fu(ker would get plasma gun, or the positron gun, and some with a bit more skill would get launcher, the game was a race to whom get the best weapon first.
The point is that you can be a pro at using rockets, Fatal1ty is pro, and he can play besy with rockets.
author: Cero Ashura

text: dude, the same thing aplies to halo, obiously you never played quake back in the day, also is game so you dont get any real "skill", also the rocket launcher isnt a spam, because is part of the game.
author: Romeo Crust

text:
You apperreantly haven't played much quake, or any scifi fps game, since in every game there are ways to get easy kills, in quake just get the plasma gun and shoot, even if you miss, you dmg the enemy, if you you shoot left, than the guys stading on your left side wil either die or have 20 hp left...
My point is that players decide wheter to play with skill or rocket spam (which is possible with quake).
author: Cero Ashura

text:
in halo you can also get the rocket launcher or the soartan laser and blast everyone!
also quakae and quake 2 were the ones that bringed multiplayer to skilled players.
author: Romeo Crust

text:
I'm talking about the multiplayer aspect... metroid is older than even me!
It was just a scifi sidescroller in the beginning. And as for HalfLife, its still a great game, it brought us some mutiplayer aspects, but certainly not of the quality as halo.
Halo has a battle system built uppon your skill, any noob on half life can get laser wepion and blast evryone off.
